question: Who gave the theory of Paternal Authority?
explanation: Filmer gave the theory of paternal authority and justified the absolute power of the contemporary kings as a paternal inheritance from Adam, to whom God gave his authority, he is the first king and first father; father of all mankind. He held that patriarchal authority was absolute and political authority is analogous to paternal authority. He also contended that men were not born free but into families, hence, relationship of subordination were natural as individual are subject to the authority of their fathers.
